intro: Acosta kilaea, commonly known as the Hawaiian kahili, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Acosta kilaea thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of Hawaii.
